Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: zyskokid
Reviews.Content: Hidden down a short alleyway but just off the Tiber and a busy intersection where buses and cabs are available, Hotel la Rovere is in an excellent position so you can enjoy much of Rome, and much of it on foot. Rooms are European small, but you won't spend much time in the room anyway with so much to see. St. Peter's Square and Basilica might be two-three blocks away, the restaurants of Travestere just a few blocks south, Piazza Navona not far across the Tiber. Complimentary breakfast -- and great coffee -- satisfying. Nice little wine bar just around the corner from the hotel. Don't miss having Carbonara Rigatoni at La Carbonara on Piazza Navona.

Reviews.Title: “Charming.”
Reviews.Author: Jane L
Reviews.Content: We loved this little gem. Third floor room has a terrace. Plenty of room for a family of 3 as we explored Roma. It's accessible to everything. My partner loves jogging in the morning...and was thrilled to walk out the door and run for miles along the Tiber river. AND the staff went the extra mile in returning an item I forgot in the room. We would definitely stay here again...such an antidote to the giant impersonal hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel !”
Reviews.Author: DiBenarella
Reviews.Content: This is a gem. Everything was done well, the room sizes, the beds comfortable, and the bathrooms roomy and CLEAN. This hotel has character and charm. I loved our room with a balcony and the alley street it was on. We felt right at home and loved the location. We walked everywhere. I would recommend this as a wonderful place to stay in beautiful Rome. And the coffee was superb!

Reviews.Title: “Best of the best!”
Reviews.Author: fennysoutherner
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel La Rovere for 6 nights in late October. It was fantastic! The location is a short walk to the Vatican and a quick walk over the Tiber River to all the other sites in Rome. We walked to Piazza Navona, Trevi Fountain, Pantheon, ...etc. The hotel is family owned and we felt like part of the family! They were very helpful with directions, restaurant suggestions and taxi reservations. The hotel is impeccably clean and the rooms are good size. We had a quiet room overlooking the gardens in the back. We will defintely return to Rome and will most definitely stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: KarolineTrieste
Reviews.Content: We go here every time we stay in Rome. It is one of the very few family-owned hotels left and has a cozy feeling. Giorgia and Luigi, the owners, along with their uncle, Lelo, really make you feel like part of the family. Also, a big plus, they are great with babies. Twice, at breakfast time, "Uncle Lelo" (we adopted him) took our 11-month-old for a stroll and gave us a chance to eat! Rooms are really nice, some have terraces, and they all have their own unique character. Finally a hotel in Rome that looks like it's in Rome. We send everyone we know here. Also, we were, again, very impressed by the cleanliness of the hotel and the genuinely positive atmosphere and friendly disposition of everyone who works there. Great location too: five-minute walk from Saint Peter's, close to bus, and not far there is a great Trattoria called Suor'eva. Would never think of staying anywhere else while in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Well Worth Checking Out”
Reviews.Author: deborah w
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 5 nights in September, our tour ended here on our first night in Rome and the Hotel graciously extended our stay with some easy preplanning a few months beforehand. Quiet and a bit off the beaten path but very well situated to be within walking distance of the Vatican, La Travestere and central Rome. Our room was very clean with a large comfortable bed, air conditioning and the luxury of a large bathroom (after tiny bathrooms at most of our previous tour stops). They also have an elevator and a nice morning breakfast. We also made use of a small terrace off the hallway to relax outside after long days on our feet. It provided a welcome sanctuary after the controlled chaos of busy days and staff was wonderful. Highly recommended, they made us feel at home!

Reviews.Title: “Warm and Inviting”
Reviews.Author: colprubin
Reviews.Content: I knew absolutely nothing about his hotel when it was booked for us by locals during a business trip. It was a very pleasant surprise. The hotel, dating back to the 1950s, has been lovingingly maintained as a family business. Our room, a triple, was big by European standards and we had a private terrace which was an unexpected bonus. The breakfast is typical Italian continental-- fresh fruit, yogurt, rolls. For me, the most important part was the coffee and it was excellent. The location is in a "real" not touristy neighborhood but within walking distance to Travestere, the Jewish Ghetto and the Vatican. If you love to walk, you can even get to the Piazza Navona, Trevi and Spanish steps. With such a reasonable price, I am planning on making this my permanent hotel in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “charming and well located”
Reviews.Author: voc124
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel twice - once when my daughter was studying at John Cabot and again with my husband and daughter. If you know Rome, this is the hotel for you. It is near the Vatican and everything else is a walk away. The wonderful neighborhood of Trestevare is nearby and right behind the hotel and up the steep stairs is one of the best views of Rome you can get. Staff will make you a cappucino anytime of day and rooms are kept clean. Reccommended by Rick Steves and he never seems to be wrong!

Reviews.Title: “Beware”
Reviews.Author: lovetoseetheworldMi
Reviews.Content: I inquired about a reservation for myself and two friends, and after never receiving a response, assumed that no rooms were available and made other accommodation arrangements. After returning home from a lovely holiday in rome and florence, I noticed that I had been charged a nights stay at this hotel. They insisted to my credit card company that I was a 'no show'. I NEVER received any sort of confirmation of a reservation with this hotel. They were unwilling to address the matter with me. I did not contact the hotel directly initially, so maybe they just have listings with some shady intermediaries, but I do not feel I was treated properly in the end. Would HIGHLY recommend Hotel Alimandi Vaticano in Rome. Would stay there again in a hearbeat!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Uncomfortable Stay! Mosquitos, No Use Of Air Conditioning, Limited Internet”
Reviews.Author: aw525_2
Reviews.Content: This little hotel of some 12 units is located off a small noisy alleyway about a 10-15 minute brisk walk from St. Peters. Although I am sure there are far worse, this is not a hotel we would return to or recommend. To be fair the room was clean and the bed comfortable - and although the mildew smell from the bathroom permeated the room there was no visible sign of it. As noted in the photos, the common areas are appealing enough, however the furnishings of the individual rooms are somewhat worn and tired. The biggest problem was one I had not even anticipated. To air and cool the room we opened our window; however since there were no window-screens, we were swarmed with mosquitoes. When I explained the problem and requested the use of the advertised air conditioner so we could sleep, I was told it was “not possible” and so we sweltered, aggravating the many, many hot, red welts across our arms and legs. In a similar vein, we were told the Hotel had Internet access. Unfortunately this turned out to be capricious permission to use a Hotel computer rather than Wi-Fi etc. I was variously told access was “not possible” (even though it was fully functional) whether late one night to contact a US colleague, or early in the morning to check on airline information. As for directions, don’t bother asking the desk, just bring a map, or wander about. We consistently found the staff to be unhelpful, patronizing and condescending. Aside from our frustration, overall we do not believe the Hotel represented value for money.

Reviews.Title: “not what we expected”
Reviews.Author: billmelaterSF
Reviews.Content: We are staying at the hotel this week. I emailed for directions but got no reply. Fortunately we met a guide on the train from the airport and he was able to provide directions. Take the 64 bus. Get off at the first stop past the river. Cross the wide road. Look for their sign over the alley heading uphill. When we checked in, we asked if our room was on the quiet side of the hotel. The answer was an enthusiastic yes, but the room is the ill fated 205, above the street. I asked to use the internet. They said it was broke but would be fixed the next day. I asked the next day and again was told it would be fixed the next day. Yesterday, I had them show me the router and cables. No wireless router, even though they said they did have one. The cabling to the computer is exposed and runs along a power line. This causes the router to fail. I showed them how to power down and power up the router. It fixed the problem for now. The computer is running an old version of the browser. The keyboard is Italian. No way to type the "at" sign in an email address. Very friendly people though. They just do not want to give you an answer that you might disagree with. The hotel is up an alley. The alley seems to be a pissing ground for the locals. It is out of the way, and it is better than pissing in the river. St Peters is close, but not 100 meters unless you swim the river upstream. I say maybe a 2 star given the location and lack of competence, but very friendly with a good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel, friendly staff, good location”
Reviews.Author: SarahInSeattle
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a week at Hotel La Rovere earlier this month. The hotel is located an easy walk to the Vatican, as well as near several major bus routes. It was neat as a pin, had helpful staff (who all spoke some English; no difficulty with communications), and I very much enjoyed my stay. The breakfast was simple but quite adequate - croissants, cheese, ham, cereals, fruits, yogurts, as well as a cappuccino made for each person who wanted one. And the breakfast room and hotel in general were pleasantly decorated. I had one of the three rooms with a very spacious balcony/terrace. My view was toward a lovely church (Chiesa Nuova), across the Tiber River. I enjoyed having a glass of wine on the balcony in the evening or a glass of juice in early morning, relaxing at the table there. The room was impeccably clean. The small TV had a satellite feed, including one English station, CNN. The bathroom radiator was also the towel rack (thus the "heated towel rack" that some people refer to), and the bathroom was completely modern, with usual facilities, incl. a shower with plentiful hot water. I do wish that the very firm bed was slightly softer, but that's a small point. I enjoyed the fridge (altho' I didn't buy anything from the mini-bar), the safe, and the lovely, large windows that let in such great light but which could be completely covered and darkened for a quick afternoon nap. In addition to the hotel itself, I enjoyed its location - on a tiny, quiet street, but just steps faway rom a more major road that had a small grocery, internet shop, pizza shop, and nearby trattoria, as well as good bus service. If I go back to Rome, I definitely will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: toomeyd
Reviews.Content: My Girlfriend and I stayed there for a week; we found the staff to be very friendly. The room size for the price was good and we had our own large private terrace from the room, which was an added bonus. The location was good, 10-minute walk to the Vatican and a 30 min walk to pizza navona. And the area felt safe. All in all it was a very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Malcolm318
Reviews.Content: This hotel is near the Vatican on the west side of the river. There are almost no shops or restaurants nearby and there is no Metro station either so be prepared for lots of walking. That said, the hotel is fine. Our room was small by US standards but typical European. Small city hotels are sometimes noisy but we had no problem and slept really well. The staff seemed a bit uncommunicative at first, but were actaully quite friendly when we got to know them. Breakfast is typical continental cold buffet. The hotel is in a very narrow street set back from the main road running along the side of the river and the taxi driver dumped us down at the main road and pointed us in the direction of a small (dirty) alleyway where there is a direction sign for La Rovere. Do not let him do that - insist on being taken to the front of the hotel. The Travestere district is excellent for the evening meal (its like the Latin Quarter in Paris only better). Just walk south along the river for about 15 mins. You have to walk along the side of the river to get pretty much anywhere so during the day it's nice to use the steps down to the lower embankment and get away from the traffic. You can get back up to street level at any bridge. For a great half day out take the train from the station near the Pyramid (30 mins walk) to the ruined port city of Ostia Antica, it's great.

Reviews.Title: “Rude, unhelpful staff and taxi rip-off”
Reviews.Author: LBJS
Reviews.Content: The hotel is generally fine, quiet etc., but the radiator in our bathroom didn't work for our entire stay (and Rome in Jan is cold!). Each time we mentioned it we were told someone would look at it "tomorrow". We were not offered another room, and on the final evening (when neither the main room radiator nor the bathroom radiator were working) the desk staff were extremely rude, saying they were warm enough, there was nothing they could do. Additionally, we asked for a taxi back to Ciampino airport (which had cost E46 on our trip into Rome). We were taken by someone who was not a taxi and who charged us E60. We would not return to this hotel, or recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “An Okay Stay”
Reviews.Author: msmilow
Reviews.Content: The location was perfect for visiting the Vatican, though the small crumbling alley that led to the hotel might make one nervous upon returning to the hotel at night. Our accomodations were quite adequate but the room was dark and the decor not very attractive. The bathroom was modern and kept very clean though and we were provided with plenty of towels. The breakfast which was included was fine and available in a very nice dining room. The staff were courteous and it was very pleasant to have our coffee and tea served to us in the morning. Overall I would have to say that given the expense of accomodations in Rome, this hotel was fine but not exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Good Quality Clean Hospitable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just back from a six day break in Rome. The hotel Rovere we found was in a good location. Round the corner from the Vatican (5 mins) Piazza Navona (10 mins) don't buy a drink from the bars on Pza Navona nearly died. Roem is very walkable the only place we caught a bus to was the Catacombs. Anyway back to the Hotel. The staff were very courteous, some spoken English. The room was adequate, afterall you don't spend a lot of time in there. We had the standard double. Bed was a little hard and was 2 singles pushed together. T.V. is all Italian only english channel is CNN. Bathroom was large. Wife was disappointed because it only had a shower and not a bath!! Safety deposit box in the room was free which was a good thing. View from our room was not good (other houses) but you expect this in Rome. Found that there was no ventilation in the room so sometimes stuffy. Too many mosquitos to have the window open at night as we found out. Breakfast was adquate. rolls, croissants preserves, boiled eggs done at 7.00 so cold by 9.30! cold meat, cake so good choice. Get the younger guy to make your cappuccino, his is the best. Try not to ask the hotel to arrange taxi transfers. From Ciampino Airport we got a taxi to the hotel and it cost us 40 euros (price negotiated before we got in). The hotel arranged a taxi for us to the airport and it cost 60 euros!! Restaurant round the Corner Sor'ema is good. Taverna Guilia across the bridge and a little further is rubbish. Try Anticca Trattoria Polese. Across the bridge keep walking past the bus station past a church set back on your right you will come to a small square it is along the back of the square. We ate here 3 times and were never disappointed. On the way to this restaurant there is a supermarket so get your water and snacks from here. Would I stay at the Hotel Rovere again Yes. Its not cheap but neither is Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: byblox
Reviews.Content: We stayed in La Rovere for 5 nights and were very pleased with our overall stay. The location is within walking distance of the Vatican, Piazza Navona and the Trastevere area. The room was small, we upgraded to a deluxe room with terrace, it was expensive (€150+ p.n) but the terrace was spacious and well maintained. Air conditioning was optional but was surprisingly unneccessary. Room was clean and bathroom was large, cleaned thoroughly daily, small shower cubicle though. Safe in room and a minibar, plenty of storage. Small lift to all floors. Quiet, off a cobbled street, surrounded by private houses and apartments. Transfers from airport to and from hotel were arranged by staff, €60 each way so it is steep, airport was about half an hour away by mad italian taxi! (nerves of steel required) Good broad range of breakfast included in room price, buffet style, rolls, cheese, yogurt, cereal, fruit etc. Nearest eating out area was the Trastevere area, reception was open through the night for late nighters. No bar or restaurant within the hotel. Attentive and pleasant staff (unlike many restaurants!) We would certainly recommend this hotel as a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Quiet in Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at La Rovere for 3 nights. It is in a very quiet and central location in Rome. The staff was extremely friendly and our triple room was quite large with a clean bathroom. We had a private balcony and although the view was nothing special, we enjoyed sitting out there after a long day of sightseeing and walking, with a nice bottle of wine to feel the evening breeze in this magnificent city. The hotel is in an excellent location. The Vatican was a mere 5 minutes away, Piazza Narbona and the Pantheon 10 minutes away, the Colisseum and Forum 20 minutes away, Trastevere is 15 minutes away and Via Veneto was the farthest (NOT within walking distance!). Unlike other cities in Italy, Rome is not an easy city to walk since it's very spread out but if you choose to, this is a great location to start your walking tours. However, I recommend taking advantage of the metro and taxis as we were so exhausted after our third day in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good all round hotel”
Reviews.Author: CAR13
Reviews.Content: Great base for exploring Rome on foot. Vatican 10 mins, central Rome 20 mins, Colosseum and Spanish Steps 30 mins. Rooms clean with air con (extra charge), safe, fridge/bar, decent sized bathroom. Hotel away from hustle and bustle in quiet cobbled street. Good continental breakfast. Helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “La Rovere is a great place!”
Reviews.Author: vergil
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with La Rovere in all respects. Wonderful friendly staff. Very quiet and pleasant rooms. Excellent location for seeing the city center and Vatican.

Reviews.Title: “We strongly recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: anadora
Reviews.Content: We are very pleased from our staying in Hotel La Rovere: absolutely quiet, very clean and situated in a very convinient and secure region for tourists (next to Vatican). Breakfast is decent. Although the rooms are small, the whole atmosphere and friendly service gives you the best impression (we paid 120 Euro per night - including taxes and breakfast) - extra charge 10 Euro if you would like to use AirCondition. In order to reach hotel from the airport, we preferred to use FM line which costs 5 Euro, get off at Trastevere station and then take a taxi (cost about 10 Euro). There is no metro station near hotel. We strongly recommend you this hotel for your visit in Rome. Have a nice holiday..

Reviews.Title: “Be Treated like family”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel La Rovere for seven days and felt that this family run hotel felt more like home than a hotel. He felt the location was excellent for exploring Rome. Extremely close to the Vatican but with it's location below Monte Gianicolo provide breath taking views of the city both during the day and at night by taking a short walk. Walking up or down the Tiber proved to be the best way to get to the major Roman sites such as the Fountain of Trevi, Spanish Steps, Piazza Novano etc. The Gallo family made us feel like family. Price was reasonable based on the service the hotel staff provided.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not cheap”
Reviews.Author: domnl
Reviews.Content: Hotel la Rovere is a nice 3star hotel, just off the centre between centre and vatican. Advantages are its relatively quiet location, good rooms, small size hotel, european city style (if you like it) Breakfast is continental plus, no hot food. standard room (March 2004) was 150 eu, superior room 175. Superior has a balcony but the view is not special and the room is larger. Beds are comfortable but not soft. Airco is to be paid an extra 10 eu/day.Location is not bad but there is only one restaurant around the corner. On 10 minutes walk you enter the trastevere 'wine and dine' quarter. For another restaurant at 10 minutes look for cocodrilo at via Giulia at the other side of the river, great! Vatican is only 5 minutes, centre main attractions 10 minutes; so: close enough.We liked it though I think it is not cheap.Little English spoken but friendly personnel.

HotelInfo.Name: La Rovere
HotelInfo.Address: 5 Vicolo Sant'Onofrio, 00165 Rome, Italy
